means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 索尔特 Salter的变体，或住所名称，盐井所在地

word_mean: 盐类：酸中的氢原子被金属原子置换所成的化合物，或既含碱基又含酸基的化合物
〔复〕盐类泻剂：见magnesium sulfate (Epsom s.)、sodium sulfate (Glaubers s.)及potassium sodium tartrate (Prestons，Rochelle或 Seignettes s.)
盐粉播撒，salt-seeding  用运载工具（飞机、火箭等）把盐粉播入催化云的作业过程。

phrase.cizu_name: rub salt into the (或 someone's) wound

jx.jx_en_mean: make a painful experience even more painful for someone
jx.jx_cn_mean: 在某人伤口上擦盐，使某人痛上加痛

jx.jx_en_mean: a person or group of people of great kindness, reliability, or honesty
jx.jx_cn_mean: 社会中坚，最高尚的人，最值得信赖的人

jx.jx_en_mean: be of lower social standing or worth

phrase.cizu_name: take something with a pinch (或grain) of salt

jx.jx_en_mean: regard something as exaggerated; believe only part of something

lj.lj_ly: I take anything he says with a large pinch of salt.
lj.lj_ls: 我对他所说的一切都要打个折扣。

jx.jx_en_mean: good or competent at the job or profession specified
jx.jx_cn_mean: 胜任的，称职的，有能力的

lj.lj_ly: any astrologer worth her salt would have predicted this.
lj.lj_ls: 任何一个称职的占星家都会预测到这一点。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)secretly store or put by something, especially money
cause soap to separate from lye by adding salt
jx.jx_cn_mean: 加盐使皂从碱液中分离出来

jx.jx_en_mean: To separate (a dissolved substance) by adding salt to the solution.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 盐析：通过向溶液中加盐而分离出（溶解的物质）

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English sealt (noun), sealtan (verb), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch zout and German Salz (nouns), from an Indo-European root shared by Latin sal, Greek hals 'salt'

entry.def: Salt is a strong-tasting substance, in the form of white powder or crystals, which is used to improve the flavour of food or to preserve it. Salt occurs naturally in sea water.

example.ex: Season lightly with salt and pepper.
example.tran: 略微加点盐和胡椒调味。

entry.def: When you salt food, you add salt to it.

example.ex: Salt the stock to your taste and leave it simmering very gently.
example.tran: 根据自己的口味给原汤加点盐，然后用文火慢炖。

entry.tran: 盐，盐类(酸和碱的化合物)
entry.def: Salts are substances that are formed when an acid reacts with an alkali.

example.ex: The rock is rich in mineral salts.

entry.tran: 人中豪杰;社会中坚;吃苦耐劳的人
entry.def: If you describe someone as the salt of the earth, you have a lot of respect for them as the type of person who deals with difficult or demanding situations without making any unnecessary fuss.

example.ex: Most of the people there are salt-of-the-earth, good, working-class people.
example.tran: 那里的大多数人都是吃苦耐劳、心地善良的工人阶级。

entry.tran: 对…半信半疑;不完全相信
entry.def: If you take something with a pinch of salt, you do not believe that it is completely accurate or true.

example.ex: The more miraculous parts of this account should be taken with a pinch of salt.
example.tran: 对这篇记述中那些颇具神奇色彩的部分也不应全信。

entry.def: If you say, for example, that any doctor worth his or her salt would do something, you mean that any doctor who was good at his or her job or who deserved respect would do it.

example.ex: Any coach worth his salt would do exactly as I did.
example.tran: 任何称职的教练都会采取和我一模一样的行动。

entry.tran: 往伤口上撒盐;雪上加霜;落井下石
entry.def: If someone or something rubs salt into the wound, they make the unpleasant situation that you are in even worse, often by reminding you of your failures or faults.

example.ex: I had no intention of rubbing salt into a friend's wounds, so all I said was that I did not give interviews.
example.tran: 我不想往朋友的伤口上撒盐，所以我只说我没有进行面试。

means.word_mean: 1. a compound formed by replacing hydrogen in an acid by a metal (or a radical that acts like a metal)
2. white crystalline form of especially sodium chloride used to season and preserve food
3. the taste experience when salt is taken into the mouth

sentences.sentence: "the rebels had salted the fields with mines and traps"
"people used to salt meats on ships"

means.word_mean: 2. of speech that is painful or bitter;
3. one of the four basic taste sensations; like the taste of sea water

list.explanation: (=pepper and salt)(吸毒者用语)含杂质的或劣质的大麻

example.en: This salt and pepper is oregano, I think.
example.zh: 我有这种含杂质的大麻是牛至吐粉。

auth_sentence.content: Pass through a fine sieve and season with salt.
auth_sentence.res_content: Pass through a fine sieve and season with salt.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Pass through a fine sieve and season with salt.

auth_sentence.content: Drain on kitchen paper then sprinkle with sea salt.
auth_sentence.res_content: Drain on kitchen paper then sprinkle with sea salt.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Drain on kitchen paper then sprinkle with sea salt.

auth_sentence.content: Season the rice with ground ginger and rock salt.
auth_sentence.res_content: Season the rice with ground ginger and rock salt.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Season the rice with ground ginger and rock salt.

stems_affixes.word_buile: sal盐+ary表名词→古代工钱以给盐多少计算
saline[adj.含盐的,盐的]+ity表名词→n.盐分,盐度

stems_affixes.value_cn: 食盐, 风趣, 刺激
stems_affixes.word_buile: sal盐+t→n.食盐, 风趣, 刺激

stems_affixes.value_cn: [化]使成盐, 使变咸, 使与盐结合

Sentence.sentence: Just when you had figured out how to manage fat in your diet, researchers are now warning against another common mealtime pitfall (陷阱) — salt.

A study by researchers at the University of California, San Francisco (UCSF), Stanford University and Columbia University shows that even a modest decrease in daily salt intake (摄入) can lead to dramatic health benefits

The authors documented an annual drop of as many as 120,000 cases of heart disease, 66,000 instances of stroke and 99,000 heart attacks caused by high blood pressure after a 3-g-per-day reduction in salt.

Stored underground in large salt caves in Louisiana, this stockpile is called the Strategic Petroleum Reserve, and currently contains over 600 million barrels of oil, roughly equivalent to one month's supply.

sentences.en: Salt occurs naturally in sea water.
There is considerable salt in the kitchen.

means.word_mean: 味道或外观等像盐的物质; 药用盐类

sentences.en: Salts is a medicine that causes movements of the bowels.
sentences.cn: 泻盐是一种促使肠子运动的药物。

means.word_mean: 增添趣味[活跃气氛]的事物

sentences.en: Her witty remarks added a little salt to the conversation.
sentences.cn: 她的妙语使谈话增添了一些风趣。

sentences.en: Adventure is the salt of life to some men.
sentences.cn: 对有些男子而言, 冒险是生活的乐趣。

means.word_mean: 加盐于…以调味; 用盐腌

sentences.en: I forgot to salt the dish.
The fish are cut and salted.

means.word_mean: 把盐撒在路面上（以使冰雪融化）

sentences.en: The main roads have been salted.
He employs an irreverent humour to salt his observation.
sentences.cn: 他运用玩世不恭的幽默使他的评论更加有趣。

jushi.english: This year the commune expects to increase the area of its salt fields to 4500 mu.
jushi.chinese: 今年乡里打算把盐场面积扩大到4500 亩 。

jushi.english: She is economical with her use of salt when cooking.
